channel.title: sharktankguide – Shark Tank Guide
channel.description: Some of my favorite Shark Tank products

item.title: Drop Stop – The Original Patented Car Seat Gap Filler
item.dc:creator: sharktankguide
item.content:encoded:
I love this product! I can’t tell you how many times I’ve dropped my phone or a box of mints or even my car keys in between the seat and the console! The Drop Stop fits perfectly in that space and prevents items from falling through the cracks. The less distracted you are, the safer you are.

  • WE ARE THE ONLY SOLUTION WITH 100% GAP COVERAGE – IN FRONT OF, SURROUNDING, AND BEHIND SEAT BELT CATCH. Drop Stop attaches to the seat belt catch via built in slot; moves with the seat and no need to readjust or reinstall.
  • AS SEEN ON TV/SHARK TANK, Drop Stop blocks that annoying yet ever so dangerous gap between your car or truck seat and center console
  • BEWARE OF CHEAP KNOCKOFFS AND COUNTERFEITERS!!! IF IT DOESN’T SAY DROP STOP ON IT, THEN DON’T BUY IT! Drop Stop is the Original and Patented Car Seat Gap Filler. Every other product that claims to fill the gap works poorly, or not at all. Drop Stop will never fall apart and lasts a lifetime!
  • Each package comes with 2 Drop Stops (1 for the driver side and 1 for the passenger side; universal fit), a Slide Free Pad and an LED Credit Card Light
  • One size fits most vehicles! High Grade Neoprene casing allows Drop Stop to contract or expand to whatever size gap you have. One color blends all! The Gap is always a dark shadow so once you install Drop Stop, you won’t know it’s there until it Stops the Drop!
Buy Now on Amazon for

Read More
item.content:encoded:
Designed by experts, loved by critics. The Seventy2 Survival System is the world’s best 72 hour Survival Kit. Don’t believe us? Just ask TIME, Outside Magazine, Huffington Post, Field and Stream, and dozens of other critics who have praised the Seventy2 for it’s design, quality and ease of use in survival situations.
95% of all survival situations are resolved within 72 hours, but the first 72 hours are extremely critical. Having the right gear can mean the difference between life and death. With that in mind, we worked closely with first responders, doctors, special forces operators, mountain guides and other experts to develop the world’s best seventy two hour survival kit, a product that changes a potentially deadly situation in to a minor inconvenience.
Introducing The SEVENTY2 Survival System. The world’s first fully-integrated 72 hour survival system. Patent Pending.

Buy Now on Amazon for

item.title: Cup Board Pro
item.dc:creator: sharktankguide
item.description:
I have to admit, I got a little emotional during the pitch for Cup Board Pro. Here were three young people promoting a product made by their father. His dream was to pitch his creation on Shark Tank, but passed away just a few months before. Keith Young was a NYC fireman and was one...
Read More
item.content:encoded:
I have to admit, I got a little emotional during the pitch for Cup Board Pro. Here were three young people promoting a product made by their father. His dream was to pitch his creation on Shark Tank, but passed away just a few months before.

Keith Young was a NYC fireman and was one of the first responders during 9/11. Unbeknownst to him, he had developed synovial soft sarcoma, a rare form of cancer caused by his exposure at ground zero. He always loved cooking and had even appeared as a contestant on Chopped and won both times! His love of cooking gave him the idea to create his unique cutting board. “The Cup Board Pro” is made of bamboo and has a cup that attaches to catch all the drippings. The board is angled so the juices from along the groove right into the cup! It’s an ingenious invention.

But the story is even more heartbreaking. Keith invented his product in 2010, but he had to put his idea away and help his wife after she was diagnosed with Breast Cancer. She died in 2012.

So his three brave children went on Shark Tank and even showed their father’s audition tape. All the Sharks were moved and they did something I have ever see before. They asked Keith’s children to leave the tank while they discussed a deal. They decided to all work together and offer $100,000 for a 20% stake in the business and promised to donate all their profits to a charity that helps firefighters affected by 9/11.

You too can support Keith Young and the NYFD by purchasing the “Cup Board Pro” from Amazon.

item.title: Bantam Bagels
item.dc:creator: sharktankguide
item.description:
I love bagels, but never even thought about making a stuffed bagel out of the hole! Well thanks to Nick and Elyse Oleksak we didn’t have to! Before appearing on Shark Tank they had sold about $200,000 worth of bagels out of their NYC retail store. Since making a deal with Lori Greiner their sales have...
Read More
item.content:encoded:
I love bagels, but never even thought about making a stuffed bagel out of the hole! Well thanks to Nick and Elyse Oleksak we didn’t have to!

Before appearing on Shark Tank they had sold about $200,000 worth of bagels out of their NYC retail store. Since making a deal with Lori Greiner their sales have gone over $20,000,000 and their products are sold at over 20,000 stores including 1,500 Starbucks locations, Delta Airlines and several hotel chains. 

In October 2018 Bantam Bagels announced they had been purchased by T. Marzetti Company, a wholly owned subsidiary of Lancaster Colony Corporation for $34M. 

If you haven’t tried Bantam Bagels yet you can order them direct from Amazon.

It makes washing dishes easier and more fun. Order your own Scrub...

item.content:encoded:
Who doesn’t love a sponge with a smiley face? Apparently everyone does! After getting a deal on Shark Tank with Lori Greiner ($200,000 for 20%), Scrub Daddy has gone on to sell more than $170,000,000!

I love using the Scrub Daddy at home. It makes washing dishes easier and more fun.

Order your own Scrub Daddy on .

item.title: Prank-O
item.dc:creator: sharktankguide
item.description:
I fell for this company as soon as I heard their pitch on Shark Tank. How could you not love a business that sells an empty box for $8? One of the founders worked at The Onion, the other is an experienced Graphic Designer. Together they have created a company that sells prank gift boxes....
Read More
item.content:encoded:
I fell for this company as soon as I heard their pitch on Shark Tank. How could you not love a business that sells an empty box for $8?

One of the founders worked at The Onion, the other is an experienced Graphic Designer. Together they have created a company that sells prank gift boxes. You buy a box for a prank gift and then include your real gift inside. What a brilliant idea!

They were featured on Season 10, Episode 7 and received multiple offers but ultimately accepted a deal from Barbara. I can’t wait to see how their company does.

Visit Prank-O on Amazon
